result.execSummary:
The defendant Russell Thomas Brownrigg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: This judgment is for fines, court costs and restitution that you were ordered to pay through Dept of Corrections - if not paid during probation - or you get revoked  and have not paid in full - you will be required to pay to the Clerk of Courts any unpaid amount plus interest.

supervisions.notes: Count 1: Withold sentence. 1 year probation. $ 443.00 costs only. Complete any programs probation deems necessary.   Def. to report to Probation & Parole today.

miscConds.notes: $443.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Russell T. Brownrigg in court with attorney Jamy Richard Johansen.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts. State to amend Ct 2 to straight disorderly. Motion granted. DEF pled N/C. Victim rights: letter sent, no reply. Joint recommendation. Found guilty.
Count 1:   Dismiss and read-in
Count 2: Withold sentence. 1 year probation. Fine/forfeiture $ 443.00 costs only. Complete any programs probation deems necessary.   Def. to report to Probation & Parole today.
Count 3: Withhold sentence.Fine/forfeiture $100. + costs ($579.00)
Right to seek post-conviction relief given.

Defendant Russell Thomas Brownrigg in court with attorney Jamy Richard Johansen.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint.  Court enters NOT GUILTY plea on behalf of DE to Count 1.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 11:00 am.
